name: Leonardo Hotel Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in December 2012. A very modern hotel (considering it only opened several months before we stayed here). All furnishings were new and well kept. Staff were very helpful. Free wifi was available on the common computers in the lobby. He location was a little outside the city centre and took approx 20mins to get there by foot.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: I was there for 8 night because of congress and i couldnt find any other hotel at that time.it doesnt have room service and if you want something as like as extra towel it will be impossible.rooms are small .breakfast was poor and expensive .bath room is very small .it doesnt have pool and ..
reviews.title: It isnt good for rest and family

reviews.text: I stayed at the Leonardo Hotel in Vienna for 4 nights. Location is great (one block from Mariahilfer Strasse), metro station nearby - with the big Westbahnhof (from where I took my train to Budapest) just across the street. If you like to walk just in twenty minutes you will be at the Museums Quartier. My room was very clean, good amenities and the breakfast fantastic (the only problem - they didn't have a toaster... I was really surprised with that... but it ok); the staff was very helpful, specially the young lady working there around 7pm on Friday 01/18 and the young gentleman who followed her schedule (sorry I forgot all their names). They were extremely helpful during all my stay at Leonardo. It is a very convenient hotel for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Really good hotel with a good staff.

reviews.text: We checked into the Leonardo Hotel only to find that our rooms had sloping roofs and claustrophobic small bathrooms. Since we did not fancy bumping into the ceiling whilst getting out of bed, we checked out immediately.
reviews.title: A hotel to avoid

reviews.text: Stayed at the Leonardo hotel Vienna for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Great but not really worth what they are asking

reviews.text: It was good and solid, but would not stay again. The rooms were very small. There were two of us and the twin beds were inches apart with probably ten inches on each side. Obviously not enough room for two people, let alone two suitcases. The bathroom was modern. The towels were big and new. The breakfast buffet was standard. The dinner at the same restaurant was below par. The hotel offers 1/2 hour of free wifi on one of three of their computers in the lobby. The wait for use is long. The hotel desk staff was helpful. If you intend to visit the museums, opera, etc. it is not walkable. So I would stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: It was good and solid

reviews.text: I stayed with my daughter 4 nights.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient

reviews.text: The location is very convenient - very close to Westbanhof and the airport shuttle' to Mariahilfer street.
reviews.title: Enjoyed

reviews.text: The room was specious and clean, the beds comfortable. There is a kettle, coffee and tea available.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: The breakfast - a buffet with a large selection.
reviews.title: Awesome service and room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is closed to the station, easy to find. We wanted to check in at 12:00, but the lady in the reception called Santaz told us the king size bad room can't be checked in until 15:00. But only the king size bed room, all the others can just check in at 12:00! What a strange regulation?!
reviews.title: Terrible service in the reception, four stars hotel is a joke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She serviced us with no smile, no sorry and little patience.
reviews.title: Perfect – on the surface

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because we were new in Wien, and were really tired and want to sleep. I asked her again if we can check in a little earlier, so that we can just wait some time in the hotel. She rejected me strongly and said ' I can do nothing.'
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.text: What happened to her? Why so cold and unfriendly? The service of her really made me disappoint to the four stars hotel. I would never come back again.
reviews.title: NICE AND PLEASANT

reviews.text: This beautiful hotel is conveniently located with the metro station Westbahnhof just around the corner, making it super easy to get in and around town. Meanwhile, as expected from such a new hotel, the rooms are impeccable, equipped with all amenities desired. Food is also good, without being fancy or spectacular. Continental breakfast buffet with a selection of bread, yoghurt and cerial as well as fruit and veg, plus, as we're in Austria, a variety of different sausages to choose from. --- There is no (free) Wi-Fi in the rooms though. Which is somewhat disappointing. You are, however, free to use the internet on one of three computers lined up in the hotel lobby. Which we did each morning planning our itinerary. --- Despite all this sounding well and fine, our stay at The Leonardo was slightly tarnished by the fact that our room, curiously enough, had a door connecting it the room next door, albeit a locked one, rather than a fully soundproof wall. On the first night especially, that meant disrupted sleep. There weren't any problems the following nights, though, as the hotel staff, we learned, had asked the people next door "to keep down the temper". --- So would we come back? Yeah, I think so. Had it not been for the aforementioned minor hickup we would probably have given the hotel a five-star rating. Our stay at The Leonardo was, in all fairness, quite a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Great stay for a city trip

reviews.text: We stayed there for 10 days.
reviews.title: Generally good, but...

reviews.text: The good -
reviews.title: Perfect Vienna city trip hotel

reviews.text: 1) Price;
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in Vienna

reviews.text: 2) Service - the staff is great, very nice, very proffesinal;
reviews.title: Comfy rooms, but no free wifi

reviews.text: 3) Clean rooms;
reviews.title: Renovated Hotel in Vienna

description: The Leonardo Hotel Vienna is the first Austrian hotel of the Leonardo Hotels chain. It welcomes you in the city centre of Vienna: directly at the Europaplatz, close to the biggest shopping street and the train station "Westbahnhof". Furthermore, the historic town centre and the St. Stephan’s Cathedral as well as other interesting sights are easy to reach within 5 minutes by underground.
